byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ, DAVE SEMINARA and KIRK JOHNSON
byline.contributor: Dave Seminara reported from Burns, Ore., Julie Turkewitz from Princeton, and Kirk Johnson from Seattle. Colin Miner contributed reporting from Portland, Ore., Jack Healy from Denver, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bundy, the protest leader, asked remaining occupiers at an Oregon wildlife refuge to “please stand down.” The F.B.I. later said three had surrendered.

headline.print_headline: Jailed Oregon Protest Leader Urges Followers: ‘Please Go Home’
headline.main: 3 More Arrests in Oregon as Protest Leader Says ‘Go Home’

snippet: Mr. Bundy, the protest leader, asked remaining occupiers at an Oregon wildlife refuge to “please stand down.” The F.B.I. later said three had surrendered.
abstract: Ammon Bundy, jailed leader of armed occupiers of Malheur National Wildlife Refuge, calls on his followers to surrender and go home; remaining occupiers say they intend to stay, noting that they believe death of their compatriot LaVoy Finicum was murder and that jailing of Bundy is outrage.
